title: How to Start a Conversation with a Girl on Instagram: 10+ Tips to Get Her Chatting

steps.title: Ask her questions about her recent pics if she posts a lot.
steps.content: Ask her questions about her recent pics if she posts a lot. If you frame them as questions, she’s much more likely to respond to you. Keep your comments respectful and friendly for a better chance of a fun conversation . Try comments like: [1] X Research source “Wow, this beach is gorgeous. Was this last summer?” “I didn’t know you went skydiving! Was it scary??” “Your little brother is so cute! How old is he now?”

steps.title: Take a look at what she’s doing that day to chat about it.
steps.content: Take a look at what she’s doing that day to chat about it. If she posts something interesting, try sending a DM in response. You can ask her where her food’s from (if she posts a food pic), ask about her vacation (in response to a beach picture), or even give her a compliment (if she posts a cute selfie). For example: “That sandwich looks so good. Is that the new place on Hawthorne?” “Whoa, look at those views! Is this near Venice Beach?” Follow the girl on Instagram before you DM her. This can make her more likely to look at your message and respond. Reader Poll: We asked 1387 wikiHow readers, and 53% of them agreed that it’s important to ​​follow your crush on social media before you slide into their DMs. [Take Poll]

steps.title: Start a conversation
steps.content: Start a conversation with a stranger by telling her your name. This works well if you don’t know the girl at all and you’re just trying to make new friends (or flirt a little). Keep your message simple and casual so she doesn’t feel pressured. Say something like: [2] X Research source “Hi, I’m Kevin. What’s your name?” “Hey, nice to (digitally) meet you. I’m Lauren.”

steps.title: If she’s a friend of a friend, you can bring that up.
steps.content: If she’s a friend of a friend, you can bring that up. Open up a conversation by asking how she knows your friends or mutual followers. Or, simply point out how weird it is that you both know so many of the same people. For example: [3] X Research source “Wow, we have like 20 followers in common. How have we never met before?” “Hey, do you know Mark? I think we met at his party last month.”

steps.title: If she posts a lot of memes on her page, she’ll like this approach.
steps.content: If she posts a lot of memes on her page, she’ll like this approach. Pick out a meme from your personal collection (or find one on Instagram) and DM it to her privately. If you aren’t sure what to send, take a look at her page to get a read on her sense of humor. If you’re having trouble finding something, try searching “meme” on Instagram to see what’s popular right now.

steps.title: If she posts a lot, you can pick a conversation topic easily.
steps.content: If she posts a lot, you can pick a conversation topic easily. If you find something interesting or a hobby that you two have in common, open up with that. [4] X Expert Source Cher Gopman Dating Coach Expert Interview. 17 May 2019. Try not to scroll too far down, though, as bringing up a post that’s 2 years old can be a little creepy. Try saying something like: [5] X Research source “Whoa, is that the new Nikon camera in your last post? I’ve been wanting to try that one out.” “I didn’t know that you were a surfer! How long have you been riding the waves?”

steps.title: If you know her IRL, you can follow up on what you were talking about.
steps.content: If you know her IRL, you can follow up on what you were talking about. She won’t be weirded out by your DM since you two already kind of know each other. Send a quick message that references your earlier convo to jump start her memory. For example: [6] X Research source “Remember how weird Mr. Albert was acting in class today? I wonder what was up with him.” “Hey, we never finished comparing our favorite authors! I’m still hung up on the fact that you don’t like Philip K. Dick.”

steps.title: If you’re feeling yourself, you can risk a cute or funny selfie.
steps.content: If you’re feeling yourself, you can risk a cute or funny selfie . Try snapping a quick pic and sending it to her privately with a witty caption. Make sure your picture is appropriate so you don’t creep her out. Try a caption like: [7] X Research source “Felt cute, might delete later.” “Should I post this on my feed? Be honest.”

steps.title: Girls with a good sense of humor love lines like these.
steps.content: Girls with a good sense of humor love lines like these. Pick something non-sexual to keep the conversation light hearted and fun. If she likes your line, it’s a great way to start a flirtatious conversation without a ton of pressure. Try something like: [8] X Research source “Do you like raisins? How about a date?” “Are you from Tennessee? Because you’re the only 10 I see.” “I was wondering if you had an extra heart—mine just got stolen.”

steps.title: If you’ve talked before, you can get the ball rolling by sending your digits.
steps.content: If you’ve talked before, you can get the ball rolling by sending your digits. Or, you can send them over if you aren’t a fan of DMs or you aren’t on Instagram a lot. This works well if you two know each other in real life or have talked a little bit beforehand. Say something like: [9] X Research source “Hey, you seem super cool. Here’s my number if you want to chat more.” “Heyo, we met at Sean’s party last week. Wanted to send you my digits in case you need someone to show you around the city.”

steps.title: It’s the most indirect way to start a conversation, so use it as a last resort.
steps.content: It’s the most indirect way to start a conversation, so use it as a last resort. If you know a few things about this girl (what her hobbies are, what she likes to do, where she likes to eat), try posting a pic on your story to see if she responds. If she does, you can take the conversation from there. [10] X Research source For example, if she’s super into the outdoors, post a cool pic of you hiking or biking. Or, if she’s a foodie, post a picture of you trying a new restaurant in town.
